note.p: Education: University College, London; King's College, London; St John's College, Cambridge. MA

Career: Demonstrator in Zoology, Cambridge (1882-1884); University Lecturer in invertebrate morphology, Cambridge (1884-1891); made a statistical study of the variations of the common shrimp; founded the study of biometrics; Jodrell Professor of Zoology, University College, London (1891-1899); Linacre Professor of Comparative Anatomy, Oxford University (1899-1906); died of acute pneumonia
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1908 vol 80 pp xxv-xli
